course.name: Done is better - Build What Matters

questions.question: You do not know yet when a deliverable will be ready. What should you do?
options: Name what you do not know and when or how you will find out; say it out loud
Give a fake date to avoid appearing uncertain or unprepared
Stay silent and hope no one asks about the timeline
Blame others for the uncertainty without taking responsibility

questions.question: A client asks when a feature will be ready. The team lead says: "I do not know yet. We are testing X this week and will know by Friday." What does this demonstrate?
options: Communicating unknowns: explicitly stating what you do not know yet and when you will know it
Never admitting you do not know to stakeholders to maintain control
Only sharing certainties and hiding gaps or uncertainties
Sharing everything including speculation without clarity

questions.question: In your next meeting or update, what could you do?
options: Name one thing you do not know yet and when or how you will find out
Avoid the topic entirely to prevent questions about uncertainties
Give a vague answer that does not commit to finding out
Promise to know soon without a specific date or method

questions.question: Faking certainty when you do not know can lead to:
options: Lost trust when reality diverges; others make plans on false assumptions
Higher confidence
Faster decisions
No meaningful effect on outcomes

questions.question: Hiding unknowns to look in control tends to:
options: Create surprises and erode trust when the unknown becomes visible
Build trust
Reduce anxiety
No significant downside in practice

questions.question: Why is saying "I don't know yet" leadership?
options: It sets expectations and builds trust; others can align or help
It shows humility
It is required
It is not

questions.question: When you learn something new about an unknown, what should you do?
options: Update and communicate; do not leave people with stale "I don't know" information
Only update your own plan without communicating the change to others
Wait until you know everything before sharing any updates
No need to update; the original "I don't know" is still accurate
